title: See Peterson’s depiction of wenren culture in Bitter Gourd, 25–35, and Chun-shu Chang & Shelley Hsueh-lun Chang, Crisis and Transformation in Seventeenth-Century China

The love of material goods reached another peak in the late Ming. James C.Y. Watt pointed out the irony between the fact of the richness of external things the literati desired to possess in order to cultivate their cultural taste, and the ideal of the literati’s search for the simple and austere inner life. See James C.Y. Watt’s detailed discussion in “The Literati Environment
